letter of credit.translation[0].definiti: an official letter from a bank allowing a particular person to take money from another bank
letter of credit.translation[1].definiti: in foreign trade, a written promise by an importer’s bank to pay the exporter’s bank on a particular date or at a particular time after the goods are sent by the exporter
Coffee buyers in Central America are required to have proof of financing, such as a letter of credit.
when bonds are sold, a written promise by a bank that it will repay the bonds to lenders if the borrower is unable to repay them
The notes are backed by a letter of credit from Morgan Guaranty Trust Co.
